    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oai</catalog>
            <entry>oai:spindeln.iml.umu.se:skolutveckling_8</entry>

          <identifier>
            <catalog>IML-NOT</catalog>
            <entry>skolutveckling_8</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Coupled Resonant Pendulums 2</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Verbundene Resonanzpendel 2</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Pendules Résonnants Couplés 2</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Pêndulos Resonant Acoplados 2</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Pendoli Sonori Coppia 2</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Συνδεμένα συντονισμά εκκρεμή 2</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Péndulos Resonantes Juntados 2</string>
          </title>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Exploratorium in San Fransisco, USA, have small experiments called "Science Snacks" on their website. This Snack is about resonansce and mechanical energy. Here is some more information: "By taking advantage of resonance, you can cause two penulums to swing in identical cycles."</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">resonans</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">mechanical energy</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">resonance</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">mekanisk energi</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">frequency</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">frekvens</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">pendel</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">pendulum</string>
          </keyword>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Exploratorium in San Fransisco, USA, haben die 
kleinen Experimente, die "Wissenschaft Imbisse" auf ihrer Web site 
genannt werden. Dieser Imbiß ist über resonansce und 
mechanische Energie. Sind hier mehr Informationen: ", 
indem Sie Nutzen aus Resonanz ziehen, können Sie zwei penulums 
veranlassen, in den identischen Schleifen zu schwingen."</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Exploratorium dans San Fransisco, Etats-Unis, ont
de petites expériences appelées les "casse-croûte de la Science" 
sur leur site Web. Ce casse-croûte est au sujet de resonansce 
et d'énergie mécanique. Voici encore plus d'information : 
"en tirant profit de la résonance, vous pouvez faire balancer 
deux penulums dans les cycles identiques."</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Exploratorium em San Fransisco, EUA, tem as 
experiências pequenas chamadas da "snacks ciência" em seu Web site. 
Este snack é sobre o resonansce e a energia mecânica. 
Está aqui alguma mais informação: "fazendo exame da 
vantagem do resonance, você pode fazer com que dois penulums balancem
em ciclos idênticos."</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Exploratorium in San Fransisco, S.U.A., ha 
piccoli esperimenti chiamati "spuntini di scienza" sul loro Web site. 
Questo spuntino è circa resonansce ed energia meccanica. 
Qui sono un po'più di informazioni: "approfittando della 
risonanza, potete indurre due penulums ad oscillare nei cicli 
identici."</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Το Exploratorium στο SAN Fransisco, ΗΠΑ, καλεί 
τα μικρά πειράματα "πρόχειρα φαγητά επιστήμησ" στον ιστοχώρο 
τους. Αυτό το πρόχειρο φαγητό είναι για το resonansce και
τη μηχανική ενέργεια. Εδώ είναι λίγο περισσότερες 
πληροφορίες: "Με να εκμεταλλευθείτε την αντήχηση, μπορείτε 
να αναγκάσετε δύο penulums για να ταλαντευθείτε στους ίδιους 
κύκλους."</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Exploratorium en San Fransisco, los E.E.U.U., 
tiene experimentos pequeños llamados los "bocados de la ciencia" en 
su Web site. Este bocado está sobre resonansce y energía 
mecánica. Aquí está más información: "aprovechándose
de la resonancia, usted puede hacer dos penulums hacer pivotar en 
ciclos idénticos."</string>
          </description>

          </keyword>
